result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesse V Farber was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drug, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court orders the court costs of $443.00 be reduced to a civil judgment.

Court orders the court costs be paid over the period of probation. (12 months)
Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

1:10 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty William Ginsberg.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Ginsberg - regarding letter, subject is moot.  State has received a copy of the revocation packet, with no corrections, additions or deletions.  Atty Ginsberg has received a copy of the revocation packet, with no corrections, additions or deletions.  Argument by DA Christenson.  Argument by Atty Ginsberg.  Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

30 days county jail, with 23 days of sentence credit.

Court orders the court costs of $443.00 be reduced to a civil judgement.

Court adjourned at 1:14 p.m.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on October 25, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
from Atty Bill Ginsberg dated September 30, 2016 (VIA FAX)

Atty Bill Ginsberg called, is representing the defendant on this matter and is requesting the hearing scheduled on 10/04 be adjourned.  Matter adjourned to 10/25/2016 at 1:00 p.m.  Atty Ginsberg will submit a notice of retainer via fax and the orignal will be sent via mail.
43
Sentencing hearing on revocation on October 4, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Jesse V Farber
Current: 571 Cty Rd A, c/o Green Lake County Jail, Green Lake, WI 54941 United States  (Effective: 08-30-2016)
Prior: 313 Second St, Fox Lake, WI 53933
Settlement Form (PTC)

2:33 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty David Mandell.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to count 1 amended to misdemeanor possesion of Narcotic Drug with probation and will plea to count 2 with costs.  State concurs.  Atty Mandell concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 as amended and finds the defendant guilty on count 2 as charged.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Mandell.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

Count 1

SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 12 months, concurrent to any other probation.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample. 

Count 2

Court costs.  Court orders court costs to be paid over the period of probation.
Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court adjourned at 2:42 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 26, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Status hearing on April 12, 2016 at 10:30 am.
By Atty David Mandell
Status hearing on March 28, 2016 at 09:30 am.

8:42 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs defendant of his/her right to an attorney.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond.  Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the time limits.  Court will set for Status Hearing on March 28, 2016 at 9:30 a.m.

Court adjourned at 8:44 a.m.
**PROCESSING COMPLETED**
